SEARCH
Package gw.api.observability

Class ObservabilityHandler

java.lang.Object
gw.api.observability.ObservabilityHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class ObservabilityHandler extends Object implements AutoCloseable

This is a higher-order class designed to make the typical ObservabilityPlugin usage as painless and robust as possible. While the plugin itself has very strict requirements around the order of method calls, the ObservabilityHandler has only the initial ObservabilityHandler.Builder.build(String) and final close() step to ensure.

The fact that this class is AutoCloseable means that user code can take on a more familiar form:

  public void myFunction() {
    try (ObservabilityHandler handler = ObservabilityHandler
            .Builder()
            .withContext(...)
            .build(myMarkerName)) {
      try {
        var result = doSomething();
        if (result.failed()) {
          handler.fail();
        }
      } catch (Throwable t) {
        handler.error(t);
        throw t; // optional
      }
    }
  }

This is both more readable and more robust than using the ObservabilityPlugin directly, though it does have some drawbacks.

Most notably, this class does not give passthroughs to the other ObservabilityPlugin methods. At the time of writing (2021-10-29), the follow methods do not have analogues in the ObservabilityHandler:

  • ObservabilityPlugin.configureMarkerDefaults(String, MarkerConfig)
  • ObservabilityPlugin.recordCount(String, String, long, ObservabilityContext)
  • ObservabilityPlugin.recordSetValue(String, String, String, ObservabilityContext)

Author:
zfine

      public void complete()
      Declare that this function completed successfully. Effectively a no-op, unless one of fail() or error(Throwable) has been called but using this function can help with code readability.
